description1: Arizona released health benchmarks that, once met, allowed counties to reopen businesses closed on 6/29; also began allowing businesses to individually apply for reopening regardless of county
description2: Arizona reopened all businesses statewide, with some restructions
description3: Arizona lifted capacity restrictions for all businesses

description1: California entered a new reopening system wherein each county was placed into a specified reopening tier with health metrics used to determine movement to more- or less-restrictive tiers
description2: California paused all reopenings and began moving counties back to the most restrictive tier
description3: California entered a new regional stay-at-home order plan wherein each multicounty region will be subject to nonessential business closures and a stay-at-home order depending on ICU capacity
description4: California ended regional stay at home orders and returned to previous county-based reopening plan

description1: Colorado introduced a new system for business reopenings wherein counties could request new reopening designations beginning 9/29
Connecticut rolled back to Phase 2.1, tightening capacity restrictions on businesses
description2: Connecticut lifted capacity restrictions on resturants and select indoor recreation

description1: Delaware issued a stay at home advisory and tightened capacity restrictions on businesses
description2: Delaware loosened capacity restrictions that had been instituted on 12/14/20

description1: DC reopened select businesses closed on 12/23
Florida reopened select businesses statewide
Hawaii reopened select businesses closed regionally on 8/8
description2: Hawaii loosened restrictions to stage 3 on Oahu, fully reopening select businesses

description1: Illinois divided into 11 regions which would be individually subject to stricter gathering limits and business closures based on local health metrics
description2: Illinois returned to regional reopening plan after 11/20 closure, loosening health metrics needed to reopen businesses

description1: Indiana ends all COVID-19 business restrictions
Iowa reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Polk, Linn, Dallas, and Black Hawk counties)
description2: Iowa reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Johnson and Story counties)

description1: Kansas shuts unemployment system in response to large number of fraudulent claims
Kentucky reopened select businesses at reduced capacity
description2: Kentucky closed select businesses

description1: Louisiana allowed reopening of select businesses
description2: Louisiana rolled back to Phase 2, tightening capacity restrictions on businesses
description3: Louisiana reopened select businesses and lifted capacity restrictions on religious services

description1: Maine tightened capacity resitrictions on select businesses
description2: Maine reducted capacity restrictions on select businesses

description1: Maryland reclosed select businesses on a regional basis (Baltimore City)
description2: Maryland reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Baltimore City)
description3: Maryland reclosed select businesses on a regional basis (Baltimore City)
description4: Maryland reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Baltimore City)
description5: Maryland lifted capacity restrictions on select businesses statewide

description1: Massachusetts issued a stay at home advisory
description2: Massachusetts closed select businesses on a regional basis (Boston)
description3: Massachusetts lifted stay at home advisory
description4: Massachusetts reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Boston)

description1: Michigan reopened select businesses statewide
description2: Michigan reclosed select businesses statewide
description4: Michigan reopened additional select businesses that were closed on 11/18/20

description1: Minnesota reopened select businesses closed on 11/20
description2: Minnesota reopened additional select businesses closed on 11/20

description1: Mississippi lifted all public health restrictions on businesses
Nevada reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Humboldt, Lander, and Lyon counties)
description2: Nevada reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Washoe and Nye counties)
description3: Nevada tightened capacity restrictions on select businesses

description1: New Hampshire lifts capacity restrictions on select businesses
New Mexico reclosed select businesses statewide and issued a new stay at home advisory
description2: New Mexico entered a new reopening system wherein each county was placed into a specified reopening tier with health metrics used to determine movement to more- or less-restrictive tiers

description1: New York implemented a new strategy wherein new restrictions and/or business closures were instituted in county and sub-county areas in the state
description2: New York closed select businesses on a regional basis (New York City)
description3: New York reopened select businesses closed on 12/14

description1: North Carolina relaxed capacity restrictions at select businesses
Oregon reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Umatilla County)
description2: Oregon reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Morrow County)
description3: Oregon entered a new reopening system wherein each county was placed into a specified reopening tier with health metrics used to determine movement to more- or less-restrictive tiers
description4: 9 OR counties (Clackamas, Clatsop, Columbia, Deschutes, Hood River, Klamath, Linn, Multnomah, Washington) move from extreme- to high-risk tier

description1: Pennsylvania reopened select businesses on a regional basis (included Allegheny county)
description2: Pennsylvania reclosed select businesses on a regional basis (Philadelphia county)
description3: Pennsylvania reopened select businesses closed on 12/12

description1: Rhode Island issued a stay at home advisory
description2: Rhode Island reopened select businesses

description1: Tennessee reopened select businesses on a regional basis with capacity restrictions (Davidson county)
Texas reopened select businesses at reduced capacity
description2: Texas lifted all public health restrictions on businesses

description1: Vermont reopened select businesses
Washington entered a new reopening system which divides the state into 8 regions for which health metrics determine further business reopenings
description2: 5 Washington regions enter Phase 2 of reopening allowing indoor dining and expanding indoor recreation capacity
description3: Washington will allow live attendance at sporting events and will boost indoor capacity at restaurants, retailers, fitness centers and other indoor spaces to 50%

description1: West Virginia reopened select businesses on a regional basis (Monongalia County)
description2: West Virginia Loosened restrictions of business capacity and social gatherings
description3: West Virginia lifted public health restrictions on select businesses

description1: Wisconsin issued a stay at home advisory
